metadata.title: CVE-2017-5592 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An incorrect implementation of "XEP-0280: Message Carbons" in multiple XMPPclients allows a remote attacker to impersonate any user, includingcontacts, in the vulnerable application's display. This allows for variouskinds of social engineering attacks. This CVE is for profanity (0.4.7 -0.5.0).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

profanity - 0.5.1-3
profanity-light - 0.5.1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: profanity package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.5.1-3').
